description: With half of the fruit coming from Kelly Vineyard in The Rocks region of the Walla Walla Valley, this leafy offering of the variety has notes of green herbs, cherry and vanilla. It's dazzling in feel, coating the palate from end to end with velvety soft cherry flavors that linger on the finish. Some may find the aromas too green on this cool-vintage wine but the flavors and feel will make others swoon.
title: Trust 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Focused and sprightly flavors of savory leaves are shot through with lemony freshness and zing, but the freshness is beautifully cushioned by a yeasty midpalate spice. Concentrated yet light.
title: Leth 2013 Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram-Donauland)

description: Tobacco, mature plum, espresso and toast aromas lead the nose. The round, full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, mature blackberry, licorice, black pepper and toasted oak alongside velvety tannins.
title: Matané 2012 Matanè  (Primitivo di Manduria)

description: This wine is a light gold color, with appetizing pear and crisp apple aromas. Firm acidity, a lively texture and absolutely fresh flavors make it a pleasure to drink.
designation: Cuvée Brut Made With Organically Grown Grapes
title: McFadden NV Cuvée Brut Made With Organically Grown Grapes Sparkling (Potter Valley)

description: This is a dry, richly flavored and well-structured wine. A complex, spicy, earthy, cherrylike bouquet accompanies saturated flavors of currant, black cherry and pomegranate spiced with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg. It's not too full bodied and has good balance that comes from firm acidity and tannins.
title: Occasio 2012 Ghielmetti Vineyard Syrah (Livermore Valley)

description: This vibrant, delicious rosato delivers fruity aromas of woodland berry and cooking spice. On the spicy palate, notes of white pepper and clove accent a juicy core of crushed raspberry. Crisp acidity gives it a clean, lingering finish.
title: Palamà 2013 Arcangelo Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

description: Firm and juicy, this opens with intense aromas of violet, ripe berry and baking spice. The vibrant, delicious palate doles out crushed black cherry, succulent raspberry and black pepper alongside bright acidity and smooth tannins. Enjoy it soon with everyday fare or for informal occasions.
title: Paolo Scavino 2012  Barbera d'Alba

description: Sharp upon entry, this has a concentration of citrus rind amid penetrating flavors of grapefruit, pineapple, orange and nectarine. The buoyant acidity keeps everything in proportion, with just a hint of bitterness at the edge of the finish.
title: Black Hills 2013 Viognier (Okanagan Valley)

description: The nose is still rather closed but eventually reveals leather and balsamic notes. The subdued palate offers mature black cherry, spicy plum, grilled herb and a whiff of black pepper alongside bracing tannins. Drink 2016–2021.
title: Borgogno 2009 Fossati  (Barolo)

description: A very light, almost rustic red that calls for hearty meals. A sonorous note of vanilla-oak amid the cherryish red fruit accompanies the streamlined acidity from start to finish.
title: Bründlmayer 2012 Reserve Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)

description: A cool-vintage red that clocks in at a low (for Washington) alcohol, this wine is aromatically reticent with notes of green herbs, cherry, tomato paste and barrel spices. It's tart with puckering acid and firm tannins, but good fruit intensity throughout. Drinking quite young now, it will be best after 2017 and should have a long life ahead of it.
title: Coach House 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is the winery's every day generic red blend, mixing vintages, vineyards and grapes. It's forward, fruit-powered and relatively soft, finishing with astringent and herbal tannins.
title: Camaraderie NV Storm King Red Red (Washington)

description: There are enticing notes here of caramel and butterscotch that are so minute and delicate they come across as accents. Beyond those notes is Granny Smith apple and chopped fruit, over a smooth, soft texture.
title: Cirotto NV Extra Dry Prosecco (Montello e Colli Asolani)

description: Dry and bitter, this Sangiovese is better than most California bottlings, but has its work cut out for it. It shows a good range of tart cherryskin flavors, with additional flavors of acidic things like espresso and tobacco.
title: D'Argenzio 2005 D'Alfonso Sangiovese (Sonoma Valley)

description: A spicy, herbal nose and flavors of cherry and balsam recommend this softer red from Nemea. Balanced and elegant, the wine has heft but a delicate touch. Good overall flavors and acidity—pair with lighter meat fare.
title: Palivou 2004 Agiorgitiko (Nemea)

description: A blend of 60% Sémillon and 40% Sauvignon Blanc, this is barrel-fermented, with the Sémillon component being put through malolactic fermentation. The result is a medium-bodied white with a smoky, buttery bouquet and flavors of peach, passion fruit and grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Murrieta's Well 2005 White Meritage Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

description: The fruit is light and almost delicate, suggesting mountain strawberries and sour plums. The one-year-old French oak still imparts a significant burst of bourbon barrel flavor, especially in the finish, which resonates like a bourbon and chocolate bon-bon.
title: Page Cellars 2005 Libra De Carta Red Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pretty good, but surprisingly soft and heavy for a Santa Rita Hills Pinot Noir, with pastry-filling cherry, raspberry and blackberry flavors that finish dry. Tasty, but lacks the vivacity and complexity you expect from the appellation.
title: Pali 2006 Turner Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This very tannic wine is fierce and astringent at this time. It's almost old-fashioned in its puckery dryness. True, it has a deep core of ripe blackberry, cherry, currant, licorice and cola flavors that could emerge after sufficient aging, but it's not a certainty.
title: Petroni 2005 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: This new release from Waterbrook is a slimmed down version of previous efforts, with rather plain fruit flavors and no discernible new oak influence. Not that that is necessarily a bad thing, but when Chardonnay is built upon little but simple green apple fruit flavors the grape's lack of character sometimes makes you wish for the return of the good old oaky days.
title: Waterbrook 2006 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A silky, lightweight Pinot Noir that brings some herbal notes to its modest cherry aromas. Flavors are sweetly fruity, combining cherry and plum with hints of brown sugar before an abbreviated finish.
title: Wente 2005 Reliz Creek Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: This is a neutral wine with little in terms of aromatic intensity although it does not lack in definition. The goal here is to keep the palate refreshed as a before-dinner drink, and this well-priced sparkler definitely gets the job done.
title: Zardetto NV Brut  (Prosecco del Veneto)

description: A bone-dry, refreshing rosé, with tight acidity and crisp red berry and apple flavors. Classic summertime wine. Screwcap.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2007 Rosé von der Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)

description: A bit on the dry, tannic side, this Syrah's astringency hides a rich core of blackberry and black cherry fruit. It's really too hard to enjoy now. Decant for hours, or try the cellar, although that's a gamble.
title: La Fenêtre 2005 South Mesa Barnwood Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: A potentially polarizing wine, the 2005 Idyll Vineyard Shiraz boasts a complex bouquet that ranges from meaty and gamy to stewed fruit and coffee and green olive. It's likeable in a stinky-cheese way. In the mouth, the tannins are soft and Pinot-like, but the wine does show a trace of heat, adding a chocolaty note on the finish.
title: Littore 2005 Idyll Vineyard Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: This is a simple, genuine Prosecco Brut with pretty tones of peach and apricot and drying mineral tones. It has a smooth creamy quality with stone fruit flavors on the close.
title: Malibràn NV Ruio Brut  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: This is a neutral, mineral-driven Prosecco Extra Dry with a thin groundwork of peachy fruit at the forefront of sparking effervescence and pristine luminosity. It does offer lingering sweet peach flavors on the palate.
title: Montesel NV Vigna del Paradiso Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Conegliano e Valdobbiadene)

description: A little on the sweet and soft side, with Dr. Pepper and cherry-black raspberry cream flavors, enriched with vanilla, and finished with caramelized oak. This silky-textured wine is to open now.
title: MooBuzz 2006 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a broad, round Prosecco that doesn't offer detailed aromatic highlights but instead delivers a steady dose of Golden Delicious apple, pear and honeysuckle. It's got character and grit and offers steely effervescence.
title: Vigneti Fantinel NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco del Veneto)

description: The edgy, tannic thrust of Xinomavro can prove too spiky for some, but this wine has it handled. Aromas of olives and allspice lead into mild but spicy herbal and tannic notes on the palate. The earthy, slightly tart character gives the wine an indigenous, intriguing feel. Let it age or pair it with equally robust meat dishes. Imported by Amerikus Importers Corp.
title: Pavlou-Kagas 2005 Klima Xinomavro (Macedonia)

description: Very forward fruity flavors of apricots and mandarins and soft, fresh acidity lead to a finish that is more toward grapefruit. But this is essentially a soft, aperitif Grüner.
title: Bauer 2007 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: An almost forgotten variety from Greece, Kidonitsa is represented well in this stylish white. A nose of lemon, creamy oak and spicy anise leads, and on the tongue, a mouthcoating, round fruit profile is balanced with citric freshness. Deeper in flavor than many of the popular Greek whites, the wine would hold up well against richer dishes.
title: Vatistas NV Kidonitsa White (Peloponnese)

description: Despite a slightly bitter edge to its raspberry and charred-oak flavors, this medium-bodied Pinot Noir delivers plenty of pleasure. It's a soft, medium-bodied Pinot with nuances of brown sugar and coffee and a persistent finish. Ready to drink now.
title: Hill of Content 2005 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: Sassy pepper and light rhubarb aromas give this medium-weight crianza a spicy, lean outlook. The palate has tang, vibrant red fruit and mildly grating acidity, while the finish runs zesty and rings about your mouth as it does a spicy fade. A wine for current consumption.
title: Campo Viejo 2005 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: The nose of this luminous sparkler focuses on honey, acacia flower and a hint of almond nut. The bubbling is steady and direct, leaving soda-like effervescence in the mouth with little creaminess.
title: Casalnova NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco del Veneto)

description: From the Bowral region, one hour south of Sydney, this is a slightly herbal and green-tinged Pinot Noir, but one with considerable cherry intensity and a woody overlay. It's a good, medium-bodied effort, but could use a touch more richness and complexity overall.
title: Centennial 2005 Unfiltered Single Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (New South Wales)

description: Soft, ripe and chocolaty, with a raisiny quality on the bouquet. There's fading black plum and wild berry flavors; the mouthfeel is big but short on structure. Finishes with medium length and mild bitterness.
title: Graffigna 2003 Santiago Graffigna Limited Release Red (San Juan)

description: Very aromatic, to the point of being flowery. The palate is sweet and dense, with a heavy, round mouthfeel and candied mango, melon and applesauce flavors. Finishes just pure enough, with weight and pith entering the fray. Don't wait long to drink.
title: Los Molles 2010 Reserva Viognier (Limarí Valley)

description: Leafy, dry and earthy on the nose, with a hint of flowery red fruit. The palate rings with sharp acidity, which livens up blackberry, herb, black tea and carob flavors. Shows a lot of wayward, unintegrated oak on the finish but stays bright due to juicy acidity.
title: Santa Rita 2008 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Fleshy, melony scents kick it off. That set of aromas is followed by an acidic, lively palate with generic, slightly mealy flavors of peach, citrus and light oak. Long but a little bitter on the finish, but with good acid-driven zest.
title: Santa Rita 2009 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: A light, perfectly quaffable Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, the 2009 Sea Breeze displays classic grapefruit and gooseberry notes, accented by hints of tomato leaf. Finishes a bit short, but provides decent value.
title: Sea Breeze 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (East Coast)

description: Black cherry and cinnamon on the nose lead into spicy red berry and coca flavors. This is a clean, easy-drinking red that will pair well with lighter dishes like poultry and ham.
title: Skouras 2008 Saint George Agiorgitiko (Nemea)

description: Slightly muddled at first, this wine needs a few minutes to open in the glass. It slowly reveals aromas of dark spice, prune and plum. In the mouth there are sour cherry flavors and tight tannins.
title: Terredora 2007 Piedirosso (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

description: The best bargain Pinot Noir in the state. It's ruby-clear in color, dry and light-bodied, with pleasant flavors of cherries, cola, spices and cedar. Production was 20,000 cases.
title: flipflop 2009 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Fresh, zesty and on the dry side, with notes of wet stone and citrus and a finish hinting at green apples. Shows some heft, weighing in at 13% abv.
title: Würtz 2009 Potate! Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Influenced by the herbal, savory side of Marlborough Pinot Noir, with touches of mushrooms and parsnips alongside attractive wisps of cherry fruit. Fades quickly on the finish; drink now.
title: Ara 2007 Resolute Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A soft, drinkable red with hints of sweet smoke and cured meat adding character to the mulberry and blackberry fruit flavors. Medium weight with low tannins and an easy finish. Drink now.
title: Beau Joubert 2009 Oak Lane Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)

description: Composed of 40% Viognier, 39% Chenin Blanc and 21% Grenache Blanc, there's an attractive round richness to this wine. A toasty character spices up the fresh pear, melon and orange rind flavors, with a nutty accent lingering on the finish.
title: Boekenhoutskloof 2009 The Wolftrap White (Franschhoek)

description: Warm and rubbery on the nose, with earthy aromas of blackberry, black cherry and freshly laid blacktop. The palate is full, tannic and grapey, with dark fruit flavors and an herbal element. Finishes short, herbal and salty, with lasting meatiness.
title: Caliterra 2009 Reserva Shiraz (Colchagua Valley)

description: Round on the palate for a Riesling, with plumpness and sweetness to the midpalate that's balanced by hints of pink grapefruit and passion fruit and a fresh, clean finish. Patio wine.
title: Louis Guntrum 2009 Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Crisp and brisk on the palate, with hints of grapefruit, melon and fig accented by herbal, leafy notes. The flavors fade quickly on the finish, but the wine makes for a pleasant apéritif.
title: Terroir 2009 by Ant Moore Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: With 11,000 cases imported, this crisp, clean Steen should be easy to find and well worth the price. Light weight but filled with ripe pineapple and Key lime flavors accented by crushed white flowers. Drink now.
title: The Royal Valley Vineyards Wine Company 2009 Old Vines Steen Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
winery: The Royal Valley Vineyards Wine Company

description: Ripe botrytis, honey and peaches make for an attractive, open, ready-to-drink sweet wine. The acidity keeps the richness in check.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Sauternes

description: A wine that is firmly tannic, solid, chunky and dry with red fruits buried behind the foursquare facade. Fruit flavors and acidity come through more strongly at the end.
title: Château Bertinerie 2008 Merlot-Cabernet  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A dry, firm wine, with light fruits and a perfumed smoky character. It is developing in a dry, black currant, stalky style.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2008  Côtes de Bourg

description: An attractive, ripe wine with acidity and black currant fruits. This is a medium-bodied Bordeaux, the dry core ripened with a rounded, soft texture.
title: Château les Reuilles 2005  Bordeaux

description: Passerina is a little-known grape from central Italy that offers good structure and density in the mouth. It's not necessarily aromatic, but it does offer tones of almond skin, butterscotch and Golden Delicious apple.
title: La Canosa 2008 Servator Passerina (Marche)

description: Slightly sweet and confected with raspberry fruit roll-up and berry preserve aromas. A glimmer of crushed carnation flavors switch things up in the lightweight but round and soft mouth.
title: Eventide Cellar 2008 Shiraz (Wellington)

description: Black cherry, pepper and smoked meat on the nose are followed by flavors of smoked cherry, vanilla and pepper on the palate. Focused, with a spin of minerality on the finish, this is a versatile food wine.
title: Skouras 2007 Grande Cuvée Agiorgitiko (Nemea)

description: Awkward, opening with vegetal aromas that turn cloyingly sweet in the mouth. It's also a very acidic wine. Not offering much charm now.
title: Renwood 1995 Vintage Port Port (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Awkward, overripe and too sweet, a textbook wine that falls prey to Zin's traditional pitfalls. There are ripe berry flavors but they are out of balance with everything else. A syrupy, cough-mediciney texture frames it all.
title: Edgewood 2000 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: Syrupy and fruity, with flavors of peach and apple juice, spearmint and guava. The full-throttle flavors finish a little sweet, and the acid is low.
title: Shenandoah 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

description: This blend of Syrah and Grenache has minty, wet-plaster aromas, but also some pure Grenache notes. The palate runs tart, with cranberry and cherry. And the finish is tight and bitter, with more acids than tannin. A viable bistro wine but go no further.
title: Château de Jau 2002 Jaja Red (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Bizarre and unripe. Aromas of canned peaches with a strong note of the veggies, especially asparagus. The oaky overlay feels unnatural, with disembodied smoke and char flavors. Tart and acidic, and that vegetal taste returns to haunt the finish.
title: Liberty School 2000 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Marred by the faults that can and do plague Zin. Uneven ripening resulted in green, stalky aromas and flavors that are lean and tannic on the finish. Meanwhile, a cloying residue of sweetness marks the middle palate. Unbalanced and awkward.
title: Catacula 2000 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: Berry aromas come in front of a tart pie cherry and rhubarb palate. The feel is tight and acidic, so it lacks for mouthfeel and cries out for food. As a bistro or supermarket buy it offers the most potential.
title: Heron 2000 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Michel Laroche has been branching out of Chablis in recent years and his southern French effort has some chlorine notes along with aromas of mint and sweet wood. The power is up there, but there isn't suppleness to match. The palate pulsates while the finish is dark and sharp, with a burnt flavor.
title: Michel Laroche 2001 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Light in body, with pineapple and mint aromas and tart, citrusy and green flavors. Metallic on the finish.
title: Trout Valley 2001 Chardonnay (Nelson)

description: Nice wine—if you're a beaver. Dry cedar and toast overwhelms the modest fruit.
title: Domaine Georges Michel 2001 Golden Mile Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Cherry, plum and earth aromas lead into a tart, lean palate that struggles to offer more than a modicum of cherry and cassis flavors. The finish is sweet and spicy, which makes for an odd, not terribly appealing combination.
title: Val d'Orbieu 2001 Reserve St. Martin Cabernet Sauvignon (Languedoc)

description: Sweet aromas of leather and caramel seem murky and tired. The palate comes without snap, and that's despite some plum and raspberry flavors. The finish is lean and basic, and overall it's a simple wine that doesn't really taste much like Syrah.
title: Val d'Orbieu 2001 Reserve St. Martin Syrah (Languedoc)

description: Green pepper and tobacco aromas signal some of the sour fruit that appears on the palate. Tastes of beets and pie cherries and an oaky, disparate finish doesn't do much to shape things up. Too sour and scattered.
title: M. Chapoutier 2001 Petite Ruche  (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: Sweet, light and floral, but not fruity. Lemon and orange flavors yield to a zesty finish. Simple and very high in acidity.
title: Mommessin 2002 Nid D'Abeille Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Tangy cherry flavors are framed in smoky, oaky flavors. Licorice-like at the  end.
title: HRM Rex Goliath NV Merlot (Central Coast)

description: Smells a little funky, with a meaty, raw beef aroma on top of scents of green apples. Tastes thin and watery, with a suggested of appley citrus fruit flavor. The finish turns tart and dry.
title: Domaine St. George 2001 Barrel Reserve - Barrel Aged Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Rubbery and spicy in the nose, with a hint of orange peel. In the mouth, a heavy flatness sets in fast. The wine seems old, and for a rosé, it is. It just sits on your palate, tasting o.k. but needing a poke in the ribs.
title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2000 Cuvee Lou Cascai Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A wine that tastes like cheap Port. Smells caramelly and tastes overtly sweet, with berry flavors framed in tough, rugged tannins. Could be any red varietal under the sun.
title: Shenandoah 2000 Rezerve Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Grassy to the point of excess, this wine's lean, herbal flavors and lemony acids are tart and mouthpuckering.
title: Woollaston 2001 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

description: Light and oaky at first, with earth notes. But then it goes awkward, showing imbalanced berry and plum fruit and overt oak. The wine shows some complexity and style, but at the same time it's all over the place, with hard tannins that subtract from the final tally.
title: Château Camplazens 1999 La Garrigue - La Clape Controlle Red (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: Melon and peach aromas start out fine but lose clarity. Citrus flavors that aren't quite full precede mild lemon and banana on the tail end. Nondescript and turns hot at the end. Kosher.
title: Abarbanel 2001 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Vin de Pays de L'Aude)

description: Vegetal and herbal, with disageeable aromas of canned white asparagus. Tastes a little better than it smells, but hardly like a Chardonnay. Flavors are citrusy, and the wine is lean and tart.
title: Bridlewood 2000 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Earthy, smoky aromas with a hint of bacon turn gluey and artifically sweet in the mouth, with the taste of cherry cough syrup. An acceptable wine.
title: Zenaida Cellars 2001 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

description: Almost tan in color, with neutral aromas and a dull, almondy flavor profile. Round and smooth. but all in all it's boring and fading fast.
title: Domaine de la Courtade 2001 L'Alycastre Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dark and earthy, a thick, heavy wine with plummy, chocolatey flavors and big tannins, although the acidity is soft. The main drawback is residual sugar. Once that sugar hits, the palate is discombobulated.
title: Stonehedge 2001 Petite Sirah (California)

description: Light in color, in fact almost transparent. The nose is full of tomato, brier and dried herbs. In a word: it's weak. The palate is equally lean and spicy, while the finish seems starched out and on its final legs. On the plus side is a leathery feel and some dried-herb nuances that mingle below the surface.
title: Ferraton Pere et Fils 1998 Le Parvis Grenache (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Peppery and green in the nose, with black olive aromas and little ripe fruit. That green quality carries onto the palate, where things are thin and vegetal, with just a hint of sour raspberry to keep it afloat.
title: Ferraton Pere et Fils 2000 Le Matiniere Blanc Marsanne (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: Big but murky; there just isn't much focus to this leathery, full-fruit bruiser that seems to draw its energy from a powerful beam of acidity that runs through the center of things. Short on balance and charm, but big on extract and tannins.
title: Michel Picard 2001 Cabernet Sauvignon (Languedoc)

description: Dull, waxy and smelling of overcooked vegetables, this admirably full-bodied effort is just too green to be considered good.
title: Zenith 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Just barely acceptable as a table wine due to the unnatural cherry cough syrup flavors and insipid mouthfeel. They vinified it dry, but it still feels insipid, with very flat acidity.
title: Sogno 2000 Syrah (El Dorado)

description: A bit on the hot side, reflecting the extra warmth that the Pope Valley region of eastern Napa Valley gets during the summer. Made from 100% Cabernet, it's massively flavored, huge in jammy blackberries, cherries, cassis and dark chocolate. The tannins are considerable, the finish long and ripe. Best to open this wine by 2015 or so.
title: St. Supéry 2007 Dollarhide Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: An intense concentration of blackberry and cassis fruit marks this dry, opulent wine. It could easily be a Cabernet Sauvignon, with its rich vein of tannins and distinguished structure. Although it's a bit hot in alcohol, it represents one of the more successful varietal bottlings of Petit Verdot, which is normally a blending grape. Drink now–2014.
title: Frazier 2008 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)

description: Textbook fruchtig Riesling—but with the volume turned up to 11. The flavors of honeyed apple, nectarine and lime are sweet and the wine round and plump in the mouth, but then electric acids kick in, providing great balance through the long finish. Exciting to try now, but this wine should age 10-plus years without any trouble at all.
title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2010 Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: At first stark and steely, this is the earthiest of Bergström's 2009 Pinots, with a streak of beetroot, tightly wound and substantial red fruits, and an earthy base behind well-delineated tannins. Give it time to breathe, and some lovely cinnamon highlights emerge.
title: Bergström 2009 Cumberland Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a big, rich, vibrant wine, fruity enough to drink now. Mainly Merlot, with some Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, it's deliciously forward in cherry, currant, herb and new oak flavors. The vineyard is in the cooler Oak Knoll District, and the wine shows a brisk acidity that makes it elegant and refined.
title: Blackbird Vineyards 2009 Illustration Red (Napa Valley)

description: The top wine from Château Chambert is huge and densely concentrated. It has a solid, black fruited feel to it along its immense tannins. It's richness has given its structure a sweeter almost jammy finish. The wine will certainly age many years.
title: Château de Chambert 2009 Grand Vin Malbec (Cahors)

description: A very earthy Pinot Noir from the gorgeous Oppenlander Vineyard. The wine—from mostly Pommard clones—is a heady mix of aromatic mushrooms growing in dirt and bright cherry-strawberry notes, finished by a lilting lift of rose petal and supple spice. An elegant wine that would be tempting to drink early and often.
title: Couloir 2010 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: A lovely Napa Cabernet, marked by ripe, rich flavors of blackberry and black currant and the smoky toast of oak barrel aging. Dry and tannic, it's a soothing, upscale Cabernet to drink over the next few years.
title: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Picture perfect Sonoma Zin, said to be made from old-vine vineyards. It's dry, softly tannic and sweetly ripe in black raspberry, cherry and blackberry fruit, with a rich earthiness and even an umami touch of grilled bacon. Delicious for drinking now.
title: De Loach 2009 Forgotten Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: This polished wine offers an array of ripe cherry, pomegranate, persimmon and cola flavors, making it rich and sweet in the mouth. Yet the finish is entirely dry, and you'll find plenty of scoury acidity to rip through the greasy richness of lamb or duck.
title: De Loach 2009 Maboroshi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Absolutely bursting with scents and flavors of ripe cherries, this delicious wine has amazing intensity. The fruit is as fresh as any wine can be, pure and focused, sweet and still deep, with a tight intensity that suggests good things to come. You have to love its purity.
title: Ken Wright 2010 Abbott Claim Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Pieluni Riserva is a superdense and rich expression of Montepulciano that could use another 3–5 years of aging. Oak spice aromas (the wine aged in French barrique for 18 months) are evident and will relax with time, ulimately revealing black fruit, cassis and sweet cinnamon spice.
title: Illuminati Dino 2007 Pieluni Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)

description: This is a rich, delicious and balanced Pinot. It defines the modern California style, being dry, silky and ripe, showing a wealth of raspberry, cherry, cola, persimmon and spice flavors. Oak adds rich notes that are perfectly in keeping with the fruit. Drink this savory wine over the next few years.
title: JCB 2010 No. 7 Sonoma Collection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Raspberry and cherry fruit, pure and concentrated, introduces the wine aromatically and glides smoothly into the midpalate. It tightens its focus and lingers gracefully, a mouthful of tart, primary, ripe and deliciously fresh fruit.
title: Ken Wright 2010 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A little soft and herbal, in the way of certain Sonoma Cabernets, but incredibly rich, offering a heady array of flavors. Blackberries, blueberries, chocolate, sweet red licorice, pepper and toasty oak all mingle and make the wine rewardingly delicious. Seems best now and for the next few years.
title: Lyeth 2009 Chronology Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: Bottled in June 2009, nearly four years after harvest, this is a limited production wine. It has great structure, tannin and beautiful ripe fruits. With a perfumed black-currant character, it is ready to drink now, but its tannins suggest aging potential.
designation: Quinta do Mourão Rio Bom Colheita
title: Mário Braga 2005 Quinta do Mourão Rio Bom Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Strikingly pungent on first take, with crackling aromas of cactus, nettle, lime and grapefruit. Feels zesty, deep and layered, with an even mix of tropical fruit flavors, stone fruits and green notes. About as right as it gets for Chilean Sauvignon Blanc.
title: Matetic 2011 EQ Coastal Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: From its youth, this is obviously an ageworthy wine. The tannins, firm black-fruit flavors and intense acidity all point to this wine's longevity. It shows great balance, with its fruit melding into its dry structure. A beautifully polished wine.
title: Niepoort 2009 Vertente Red (Douro)

description: Delicate, but nicely concentrated, with flower and fruit nicely integrated. Meyer lemon, tangerine, pear and even a hint of candied papaya mingle beautifully, set in a fine-tuned frame of acid and mineral.
title: Oak Knoll 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: The fruit from this well-located vineyard shines in this new vintage. Cherries and berries are set in a composty, moist, loamy framework. Hints of barnyard are subtle enough to add texture and depth. Lovely complexity.
title: Panther Creek 2008 Vista Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Finely structured, this full-bodied wine is packed with black-fruit and plum flavors, with intense notes of spice and toast. With its solid foundation of powerful tannins, this is a wine for aging over 3–4 years.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2007 Falcoaria Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Smooth, soft and plummy, this wine slips in on cat's feet and spreads gracefully across the palate. A sexy mix of blue and purple fruits, cocoa, coffee, red licorice and sandalwood.
title: Ross Andrew 2009 Lachini Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Planted in 1998, this vineyard is relatively new to Soléna's lineup. Plenty of toast and Bourbon-barrel scents lift the open, with a hint of sharpness from the alcohol. Though only a quarter of the barrels were new, the spice and coffee accents are in full display, wrapped around tart red fruits. An earthy bottom, hinting at forest and mushroom, completes the experience.
title: Soléna 2009 Willakia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a balanced and stylish wine, with a solid base of solid tannins and a dry core that gives strength to the blackberry fruit and acidity. There is minerality as well as a firm, austere finish. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Château Coste Peyrouse 2007 Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)

description: Apricot and lemon marmalade aromas open up on this smooth, unctuous wine. It has concentrated honey and rich botrytis flavors, with an intense texture and fruit quality. Ready to drink now.
title: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2007 L'Abbaye  (Monbazillac)

description: A dense wine whose tannins initially overwhelm, but then blend more easily into its ripe black-plum core, which is laced with intense acidity. The wine is concentrated and very compact; a wine to age over the next 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Laougué 2009 L'Excellence de Marty Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)

description: Tormaresca delivers a beautiful expression of Negroamaro. Quality aromas of blackberry and cherry liqueur emerge on the bouquet, and oak-driven tones of almond and chocolate follow through on the finish. It's soft, plush and bold.
title: Tormaresca 2007 Masseria Maìme Negroamaro (Salento)

description: This is a lovely, gentle Syrah for drinking now with upscale fare. It's soft in both tannins and acids, making it velvety in the mouth, and the blackberry, cassis and mocha flavors are, in a word, delicious.
title: Aril 2009 Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: Great price for a Cabernet this good. It's packed with classic varietal flavors of blackberries, cassis, plums and cocoa. The tannins are rich and ripe, with an elegantly pure Napa Valley structure. Not an ager, so drink soon.
title: Black Stallion 2009 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: While it is structured and solid, the wine also has rich black fruits that are surrounded by the firm, dry tannins. There is a base of dark chocolate, wood spice and a brooding final quality to the weighty finish.
title: Château de Corbiac 2008  Pécharmant

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine has a crisp, mineral character that gives an intense texture. It is balanced, ripe while still taut and crisp. The background to this is riper yellow fruits and a full, generous aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2013 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This nose from the actor-turned-vintner's family vineyard shows tight aromas of chalk, rain on cement and lime pith and blossoms. The laser-focused palate holds to the lime-pith lead, also showing ruby-red grapefruit juice, but exercising a lot of clean restraint.
title: Fess Parker 2013 Rodney's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

description: Opulent white blossom and tropical fruit flavors abound in this superripe, concentrated Riesling. Dry in style, it's plump and round in mouthfeel, yet reined in by bristling lime acidity and a rippling vein of minerality. It's a powerful, composed and complex wine.
title: Matthias Müller 2012 S Bopparder Hamm Feuerlay Trocken Riesling (Mittelrhein)

description: This is a savory, meaty rendering of Cabernet Sauvignon, boasting aromas of cedar, smoke and soy-marinated grilled beef. Those peppered beef notes carry onto the palate, joined by hints of brown sugar. Full bodied and creamy, it finishes long, framed by supple tannins. Drink now–2020.
title: Mitolo 2010 Serpico Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)

description: The blend is Malbec with Syrah and Merlot, and the nose is earthy, with heat and grainy oak along with blackberry notes. A lush, rich, supple palate features earthy, leathery blackberry flavors with coffee and bacon notes coming from the barrel. Smooth and long on the finish; drink through 2021.
title: Proemio 2011 I Barrel Selection Red (Mendoza)

description: Very fruity, this is a refreshingly crisp lemon-flavored wine, bright and intensely tangy. It is a young Alvarinho and needs aging to bring out its ripe creamy, apple-and-pear character.
title: Provam 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a ripe, wood aged wine that has great structure as well as ample fruit flavor. It has a touch of toastiness—50% is aged in oak—although it is sophisticated and subtle. Apple, fresh apricot and green plum flavors show through the still young texture. All native grapes—35% Viosinho, 35% Rabigato and other locals from the estate—are the same used for Port blends. To bring out the richer, more rounded side of this wine, wait until 2017 to enjoy.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Dazzling acidity and crisp red cherry and plum flavors collide in this vibrant, nimble-footed Spätburgunder. Subtle spice, floral tones and chiffon-like tannins add softness on the finish. It's delicate and spry, yet finishes with length and power.
title: Rudolf Fürst 2012 Bürgstadter Trocken Spätburgunder (Franken)

description: This shows tremendous color and a luxurious mouthful of blueberry and cinnamon, with a twinge of tree-tapped molasses. There's plenty of power yet also restraint in this well-structured wine that's built to cellar, through 2020, a finish of mocha set aside for the future.
title: St. Supéry 2012 Dollarhide Estate Vineyard Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)

description: This starts with toasty, spicy oak aromas, then deep fruit flavors emerge on layers of fine-grained tannins and last through the finish. While bold-tasting and full bodied, it's not overdone. The ripe black cherry notes are balanced by crisp raspberry and cranberry, and an underlying bright acidity keeps it zooming.
title: Steven Kent 2011 Small-Lot Offering Ghielmetti Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)

description: La Arena (sand) is one of four soil-based 2012 Altamira Malbecs made by TintoNegro, and the similarities among the wines far outweigh the differences. This is ripe and oaky on the nose, but clean and approachable. The palate is medium-to-full in feel, while flavors of black cherry, cassis and vanilla end with mild heat and baking spice notes. Drink through 2020.
designation: Finca La Escuela La Arena Soil Experts
title: TintoNegro 2012 Finca La Escuela La Arena Soil Experts Malbec (Mendoza)

description: La Grava (gravel) shows only modest differences from the silt, stone and sand wines in TintoNegro's soil-based series of 2012 Malbecs. Black-fruit aromas, herbal notes and solidity define the nose, while the palate is tight, juicy and racy, with red-fruit acidity. Nervy plum and raspberry flavors come with chocolaty oak and an agile, spicy finish. Drink through 2021.
designation: Finca La Escuela La Grava Soil Experts
title: TintoNegro 2012 Finca La Escuela La Grava Soil Experts Malbec (Mendoza)

description: La Piedra (stone) opens with the same ripe berry, plum, licorice and oaky aromas as La Arena, La Grava and El Limo (the other wines in this series). The palate is bright and fairly juicy, with black cherry, dark plum, baking spice and peppery flavors. A firm, lightly toasted, racy finish seems right for this wine. Drink through 2020.
title: TintoNegro 2012 Finca La Escuela La Piedra Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Delicate mango and papaya sweetness accent this pristine, lip-smacking Riesling. While rich and round on the palate, it maintains a sunny, bright composure. A lavishly floral, perfumed wine from nose to extra-long finish.
title: Toni Jost 2011 Bacharacher Spätlese Feinherb Riesling (Mittelrhein)

description: A voluptuous white wine with a bite of acidity to keep it buoyant and vibrant on the palate, this sings in lemon zest, orange blossom and ripe yellow apple. Lushly layered, it threads a needle of stony, salty complexity, finishing with full-flavored flair.
title: Ulises Valdez 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a ripe and spicy wine that is full of dense black fruits. Tannins and spice from wood aging merge with the rich fruit, giving a dry core to the plump, generous wine. It can be drunk now, although the wine will be better from 2017.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: This full-bodied white opens with aromas of ripe yellow peach, Spanish broom, chamomile and Mediterranean brush. The round, creamy palate doles out juicy pineapple, baked yellow apple, saline, mineral and candied nectarine zest alongside soft acidity.
title: Argiolas 2014 Is Argiolas  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Made with the native Nasco grape, which is usually reserved to make sweet dessert wines, this dry, full-bodied white opens with an attractive floral fragrance of Spanish broom, chamomile and a whiff of tropical fruit. The rich, creamy palate delivers ripe yellow apple, apricot and candied ginger while a note of toasted almond closes the finish.
title: Argiolas 2014 Iselis Bianco  (Nasco di Cagliari)

description: From a beloved vineyard source in the heart of the appellation, this classic Zin-Petite Sirah is perfumed from the start, aromatically memorable in dried cranberry and ripe plum. Elegant in style, it offers soft, integrated tannins around a juicy core of brambly blackberry and brown sugar.
title: Armida 2013 Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Balanced for dinner time, and sophisticated in aromas and flavors, this wine stands apart from the pack. The boysenberry and cedar aromas are tempting, and the vivid cherry and berry flavors are satisfying. Enough tannins and acid are woven in to keep the wine refreshing.
title: Brooklyn Winery 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

description: Absolutely fresh and pleasantly floral in both aroma and flavor, this dry wine will be a treat to drink before the meal or with seafood as delicate as sauteed trout or rich as bouillabaise. Melon and apple-peel flavors and good, crisp acidity give it a surprisingly assertive texture for something so natural and fruity.
title: Graziano 2013 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)

description: Caramel aromas lead to a wine that is rich and full bodied. It has weight and concentration, along with fresh acidity that cuts through at the end. A good sense of minerality gives this wine extra texture. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2013 Domaine de Fussiacus  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Dusty pollen and mineral tones lend austerity and elegance to zesty orange peel and lemon flavors in this dry, bracing Riesling. While light bodied and spry, it's surprisingly persistent on the finish. Ends on a delicate floral note.
title: Kühling-Gillot 2012 Qvinterra Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Black cherry and medicinal aromas dominate an earthy, dense nose. A ton of energy is unloaded on a grabby, aggressive palate that's packed with cherry, plum and cough drop flavors. This is ripe, forward and fresh, with brown-sugar sweetness to the finish. Drink through 2024.
title: Luigi Bosca 2012 Gala 4 Cabernet Franc-Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Made with old vines, this soulful red opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, game, baked earth, wild herb and a smoky note. The ripe, round palate doles out ripe black plum, black cherry, grilled rosemary and wild fennel alongside solid, velvety tannins. Concentrated and accessible, it will offer several more years of sheer drinking pleasure. Drink through 2021.
title: Pala 2011 Essentija Bovale (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: This light but vibrant and dry wine smells like fresh peaches, tastes like white raspberries and wakes up the mouth with crisp acidity. A floral character comes out with the second sip, and the mouthfeel seems to broaden and smooth on the finish.
title: Holly's Hill 2014 Estate Rosé (El Dorado)

description: With a buoyant percentage of Sonoma Coast fruit added to that of Napa Valley, this is a minerality-driven wine, vibrant in the glass from start to finish, softly layered and generously expressive. Amid the suggestion of ocean salt, it offers a mix of lemon citrus and chiffon, teetering between bright and ripe.
title: Hunnicutt 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lovely aromas meld rose petals and raspberries, while flavors convey sweet cherries with a dash of chocolate. Light hints of leaf and stem add complexity to the midpalate, and a hint of bacon surprises and delights in the finish.
title: J. Wright 2012 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The most robust of the producer's elegant Syrahs, this wine hails from a warm, rocky site atop Atlas Peak. It offers a taste of baked blackberry and plum tart, with a subtle touch of leather and game. Plush, it remains fresh on the palate, finishing in a velvety jolt of chocolate and white pepper.
title: MacLaren 2012 Stagecoach Vineyards Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: With aromas of superripe fruit, this wood aged wine has a rich, toasty and lightly oxidized character, which in this case adds complexity. It is tangy and aromatic, with pear and citrus flavors that harmonize with the spicy wood accents. It is ready to drink.
title: 1912 Winemakers 2011 Vinhas Velhas Branco White (Douro)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Dense and ripe, this wine boasts sweet tannins and flavors of ripe plums. With the vintage's tight, taut acidity, the aging potential is there.
title: Château Kirwan 2011 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This is a crisp-textured wine, with a complex structure of rich, dense fruits, spice and wood. The wine is only just coming together, promising many years of aging ahead.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Ripe, fruity and powerful, this wine has intense Cabernet black-currant flavors, with plenty of richness and concentration. It shows the acidity and the bright fruit of the year.
title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. The wine shows depth and richness while also being very structured, almost severe. Weight and density is followed by extreme juiciness and blackberry fruits.
title: Clos du Marquis 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A ripe, balanced wine, with a structure that's well-integrated into its rich, sweet fruit. It has an edge of spice and bitter-orange flavors to go with the opulent front texture.
title: Château Caillou 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A finely balanced wine, with a ripe mix of mango, apricot and pink grapefruit flavors. It has a fresh edge along with a rich, full character.
title: Château de France 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A wine that shows rounded, opulent fruit. Its structure has a dark side that's melded into its rich fruits. Weight and juiciness combine on the finish.
title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Very rich in botrytis, this is a dense, opulent wine that's charged and hugely ripe. The acidity is there in the background.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This wine has an intense herbaceous quality, with fruit and nutmeg flavors. It feels and tastes powerful, with alcoholic warmth and a taut and nervy character.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This is powered by tannins while also keeping its fresh fruit intact. There is a mineral texture that's layered with a juicy fruit character on the finish.
title: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande 2011 Comtesse de Lalande Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
winery: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A powerful wine—its concentrated tannins contrast its underlying juicy fruit. This is a flavorful medley of prunes, dark plums and blackberries; the finish is marked with juiciness.
title: Château Gloria 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This wine is powerful and concentrated, with its tannins showing. It is perfumed, ripe and offers density that's impressive for the year.
title: Château Langoa Barton 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Spice and green apple flavors dominate the palate of this crisp yet creamy wine. It has a fine, dense texture, and the fruit comes through with great intensity. The wood is neatly in support.
designation: Pavillon Blanc de Margaux Barrel Sample
title: Château Margaux 2011 Pavillon Blanc de Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Spice from new wood and the superripe, botrytized fruit show strongly in this powerful, impressive wine. It has weight, structure and intensity. It will surely age for many years.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Big tannins, smoky wood notes and prominent fruit mark this wine, along with acidity and freshness. It's powerful, with the most gentle structure of concentrated dusty tannins and intensely-fresh blackberry-juice flavors.
title: Château Pichon Longueville 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94. Barrel sample. A very firm and closed wine. It has intense tannins, with the fruit following slowly behind. The structure is impressive, while the black-currant flavors are still to show.
title: Château de Pez 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 92-94. Barrel sample. DA dark, dry wine that shows its strong, firm tannins. The wine is well structured, with flavors of mint, new wood and a layer of blackberry fruit.
title: Château Magdelaine 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This has been a steady source over the years for reasonably rich, satisfying wines from the Languedoc. The 2004 Réserve has a velvety feel to its tannins, giving it a touch more polish than usual, plus dark flavors of leather, cola and earth--even a hint of bacon on the finish. Drink it over the next few years.
title: Les Vignerons de la Méditerranée 2004 Cuvée Mythique Réserve Red (Corbières)

description: A beautifully made wine, it shows very intense aromas of apricot nectar and lime peel. While it has that wonderful easygoing personality of an Asti, it is more interesting and structured than most of them. A very fine example.
title: Ricossa 2007  Moscato d'Asti

description: Deliciously soft and easy to like now. Flatters the mouth with blackberry, currant, mocha, licorice,  bacon and crushed black pepper flavors that finish dry and elegant. A blend of Syrah, Grenache, Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo.
title: Feliz Noche 2007 Mi Pasión Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: Good density and maybe a touch reduced, this is a cool syrah with cola and chocolate accents. It's concentrated and meaty, with chewy tannins and plenty of body. Call it a voluminous New World wine with ripe fruit and a distinct milk chocolate wave on the finish.
title: San Pedro 2007 1865 Single Vineyard Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

description: A fruit forward Pinot, like an orchard in the mouth, offering sweet, ripe raspberries, cherries, red plums and spices. There's a smoked meat streak that adds complexity. A nice, fancy wine for a house pour.
title: Sebastiani 2009 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Mid-gold color. Subtle aromas of creamy stone fruit. Dry, medium bodied and fresh with bright acidity and ample fruit cocktail flavors with savory, herbal and spicy notes. Soft creamy texture and moderate length. Slightly warm and viscous on the finish finish
title: Kuentz-Bas 2008 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Piercing aromas announce that this is no basic quaffer. The palate shows blazing acids that narrow everything down to citrus, lemon, underripe pineapple and Granny Smith apple flavors. While almost sour, it's not, with briney green fruit on a long, scouring finish.
title: Undurraga 2010 T.H. Lo Abarca Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

description: A big friendly wine that is rich and easygoing and just about ready to drink. The dominant aromas are of dark fruit mixed in with smoked meat and some earthiness. On the palate, it is rich, fat and easy to like, but it comes across as being a little simple.
title: Beni di Batasiolo 2000 Vigneto Bofani  (Barolo)

description: This is cool climate Cabernet, ripe but relatively delicate, with just a herbaceous touch. The texture is dry, firm, with structured tannins. It leaves an aftertaste of aciditity.
title: Rijk's Private Cellar 2002 Cabernet Sauvignon Cabernet Sauvignon (Tulbagh)

description: Pale salmon color with some copper hints. Somewhat muted nose with  subtle aromas of ripe red-berry fruit. Crisp with more lift on the palate, vigorous mousse and lively flavors of redcurrant, wild strawberry and cherry. Medium-bodied with some creaminess to the texture that persists on the finish. Well-made but not very complex.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Alsace)

description: Rich, deep gold color. Slightly reductive on the nose muting aromas. Some fusel notes break through. Broad earthy palate with moderate intensity of ultra-ripe stone fruit flavors. Fairly open-knit and soft texture, with hints of minerality. Moderately long,  warm finish.
title: Pierre Sparr 2008 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Washington Roussanne, which is two thirds of the blend here, has sharp edges and some phenolic bite – it's not a round, fruity style. Take that into account, but pair this firm, woodsy, slightly bitter wine with pork roast or grilled chops and you'll have a match made in heaven.
title: J. Scott Cellars 2009 Roussanne (Washington-Oregon)

description: Deep gold color. Quite evolved aromas of citrus marmalade, truffles and a strong earthy minerality. full-bodied with broad, earthy flavors, ripe tropical fruit and hints of honey. Rich, quite viscous texture that lacks a little acidity. Moderately long, warm finish with a hint of sweetness.
title: Marc Kreydenweiss 2006 La Dame Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This brings a boatload of flavor for the price. It's packed with fruit;  citrus, pineapple, apple, and peach, round and succulent, with just the right amount of sharp acidity to give it some verve.
title: Corvidae 2008 Mirth Chardonnay (Washington-Oregon)

description: Mid-amber in color. Interesting nose showing bright citrus aromas, honey and hints of petrol. Tangy with blood orange, tangerine and orangeade flavors, that are a little one dimensional. Medium-bodied, fruity and easy-drinking. Medium length with a crisp citrus finish.
title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2007 Goldert Gueberschwihr Grand Cru Muscat (Alsace)

description: This is a pretty, nicely balanced Rhône for immediate consumption. Attractive aromas of cherries, with hints of cocoa and cinnamon, give way to similar flavors couched in supple tannins. It's not a rustic powerhouse, but a surprisingly silky blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre.
title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2006 Les Abeilles Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Mid-gold color, with strong waxy, earthy aromas. Dry with broad savory, earthy flavors, some bruised apple, melon compote and fusel notes. Mature with a fairly rich texture, but a slightly viscous finish. Moderate flavor concentration and length.
title: Hugel 2006 Classic Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: The initial fresh fruit is only part of the story of this complex wine. It has herbal, mint flavors, some herbaceous Cabernet flavors, along with dry, firm tannins and cassis acidity. It's not powerful, but all the elements are there, well in balance.
title: Delheim 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)

description: Rich in color and aromas; the nose pushes soothing, fragrant dark-fruit aromas that carry a touch of perfume and violets. In the mouth, the wine is only moderately rich. With full acids and zest, it's not as hefty as many modern Riojas. Still, it's a well-executed Tempranillo with ample oak and good mouthfeel.
title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2003 La Vicalanda Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Youthful lemony color. Moderate aromas of ripe stone fruit, red apple with hints of honey and petrol. Broad and warm on the palate with moderate intensity of sweet and  ripe apricot and peach. Subtle earthy minerality shows through. Medium length with warmish finish.
title: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2008 Bergheim Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Pale color with fairly vigorous bubbles. Moderate aromas intensity showing mainly a medley of fresh apple aromas. Creamy mousse on the palate, slightly soft with some persistence. Similar orchard flavors prevail in the mouth Quite crisp, light to medium-bodied with a smooth finish. Simple and easy-drinking.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Cremant Brut Sparkling (Alsace)

description: Though a bit timid on the nose, this example is impressive for its intense tangle of flavors in the mouth, which run from watermelon candy, to raspberry, wet earth, leather and chocolate. A good structure of firm acidity and brawny tannins as well as the moderately long finish suggest this wine will improve with a few years in the cellar. It can also be consumed now alongside hearty fare.
title: Yering Station 2006 Shiraz-Viognier (Yarra Valley)

description: A big, ripe wine with a nice personality, there is plenty to like about this wine, and is easygoing enough and versatile enough to be a perfect candidate for a restaurant wine.  The nose shows chocolate raspberry truffles, and a touch of oak. On the palate, the same attractive notes and a decent finish. An obvious but very attractive wine.
title: Tenimenti Ca' Bianca 2004 Chersì  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

description: Petrol leads the nose, which also deals pear and melon in a solid facsimile of Alsace. The palate is lemony and cut by streaking acidity, while the flavors of citrus run tart and monotone. Finishes zesty, with green apple and lemon.
title: Undurraga 2010 T.H. Lo Abarca Riesling (San Antonio)

description: A successful showing for this 2005 Barbera; although at first it showed some interesting complexity, but was short on fruit. Over the next ten minutes, the fruit began to come through, and mixed with pencil lead and a touch of oak.  Likeable, it has a big, happy chunky personality and seems tailor made for a good, charred ribeye straight from the barbecue.
title: Vietti 2005 Tre Vigne  (Barbera d'Asti)

description: Dark and dense, with prune-like aromas. It's powerful and forward, with fudge, plum and blackberry flavors on a full, mildly tannic frame. Finishes with clamp-down bite and flavors of burnt toast and chocolate. Could stand to show more character and less generic black fruit.
title: San Pedro 2007 1865 Single Vineyard Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Not as rich and fruity as most Lurton wines from Toro, which we think reflects the cooler, wetter conditions of the '07 vintage. The nose is definitively red in nature, with spice and raspberry, while the palate is fairly tight and generic. Finishes with grab and astringency along with the taste of milk chocolate.
title: Campo Alegre 2007  Toro

description: This medium-bodied blend of 70% Sangiovese, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot offers mature berry and baking spice aromas. On the palate, round tannins temper the ripe black cherry, vanilla and coffee flavors. Drink through 2018.
title: Il Sassolo 2011 Santa Cristina a Mezzana  (Carmignano)

description: Initially, this smells horsey, minty and not entirely clean or clear. A full chunky but clumsy palate is home to dark toasty flavors of clove and spice, while fruit notes are secondary. Barrel-driven mint, spice and clove flavors dominate the finish.
title: Tineta 2015  Ribera del Duero

description: Made in a ready-to-drink style, this is a slightly creamy-textured Cabernet that hits the right notes: cassis, vanilla, black olive and a hint of menthol. It's a fruit-driven wine that lacks a bit structure, but will please most palates through 2020.
title: Vinaceous 2013 Raconteur Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)

description: This wine blends 6% co-fermented Syrah from a single lot, the fruit celebrated in all its ripe, full-bodied glory. Cherry, chocolate and barbecue flavors commingle on the soft, round palate that develops further richness in the glass. The tannic profile is strong and thick.
title: Kuleto Estate 2012 The Point Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This shy, robust red reveals faint whiffs of underbrush, leather and Mediterranean brush. The subdued, one-dimensional palate offers raisin and licorice flavors, an alcoholic warmth and brawny tannins.
title: Lazzeretti 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: The nose does not give a lot away and is very neutral—just a mere hint of freshness. The palate provides gentle fresh fruit and is rounded. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.
title: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2015 Vieille Vigne Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

description: Red berry, underbrush and coffee bean aromas lift out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate delivers red cherry, clove and tobacco notes, with firm tannins that grip the finish.
title: Mocali 2015  Rosso di Montalcino

description: The nose of this bottling from one of Temecula's most reliable producers is pretty but not terribly complex, with crushed purple flower, blackberry jelly, coffee and elderflower aromas. The palate shows Concord grape fruit flavors and a gravel-driven minerality.
title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2013 Sophia's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

description: This grape is still finding its way to consistency in California, and this bottling combines interesting black raspberry and reductive tar notes. It's light in body, with red raspberry fruit flavors and pencil shaving accents. Best served with food, since it doesn't offer a lot of compelling character on its own.
title: Parker 2014 Alisos Vineyard Barbera (Santa Barbara County)

description: Bright red berry, blue flower and baking spice notes lift out of the glass. Light-bodied and accessible, the palate offers red cherry and star anise flavors held together with pliant tannins. Drink through 2021.
title: Pinino 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This 100% Sangiovese offers red-skinned berry and cooking spice aromas. The straightforward palate offers tart red cherry and wild strawberry fruit with a hint of underbrush and loose-knit tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Podere il Pozzo 2014  Chianti Rufina

description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with plum and violet aromas. Mellow tannins frame a palate of red cherry and baking spice flavors. Enjoy soon.
title: Poggio al Casone 2015  Chianti Superiore

description: This wine opens with stewed plum, used leather, vanilla and coconut aromas. The palate is evolved, offering prune, espresso and sage flavors, with close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.
title: Romeo 2011 Riserva dei Mandorli  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this medium-weight effort carries scents of tomato leaf and Mediterranean herbs. Those highlights continue into the palate, with pomegranate fruit and a dry pleasant lightly herbal character.
title: Season 2013 Malbec (Southern Oregon)

description: Made of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Canaiolo and 10% Malvasia Bianca, this opens with red-skinned fruit and an earthy underbrush aromas. The fresh, straightforward palate evokes red cherry and chopped herb, framed by smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Sensi 2015 Vegante  (Chianti)

description: Barrel fermented and aged for 14 months in French oak, this enters with a nutty, toasty flavor around lighter fruit. Jicama, apple and white peach combine in the midpalate, then thin out quickly, with some bite to the finish.
title: Soléna 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Temperance Hill grapes are sourced for this Pinot Noir project. Barrel spices dominate, with tart berry fruit in the background. It's a solid effort, though it thins out and feels a bit stripped in the finish.
title: Sparkman 2013 L'Autre Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pungent grassy notes lead the nose of this bottling from Vina Robles, with rounder passionfruit scents as well. The palate combines flinty minerality with lime zest, kumquat and herbal flavors, recalling its initial grassiness.
title: Vina Robles 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: Dark-skinned berry and baking spice aromas lead the nose. The easygoing palate offers juicy black cherry and mocha flavors with a touch of white pepper. Dusty tannins leave a drying finish. Drink through 2021.
title: Bonacchi 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This opens with subdued black-skinned fruit and baking spice aromas. The palate is straightforward and easygoing, with black cherry, tilled soil and leather alongside flavors supported by firm tannins. Enjoy through 2021.
title: Bonacchi 2012 Casalino  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: The winery notes that these vines were planted in 1983, and the wine offers generous dry extract along with dried apple fruit. It's lightly tawny in color, with sappy acids. Best to drink up in 2017.
title: Bradley 2015 Dry Riesling (Elkton Oregon)

description: Fresh blueberry, burned caramel, black licorice and sage scents show on the nose of this bottling of a variety that doesn't often get its own stage. The tannins are light but ever-present, framing black plum, elderberry, thyme and peppercorn flavors. It's not as rich or dense as similar wines but is nevertheless a nice sipper.
title: Broken Earth 2011 Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)

description: Made of Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Mammolo, this opens with French oak, coconut, espresso and prune aromas. The palate is lean, offering star anise, dried sage, raisin and orange zest notes rather than juicy fruit. Grainy tannins give it a bracing finish.
title: Cantina del Giusto 2011 San Claudio II Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This Riserva's shy nose eventually reveals black-skinned fruit and a whiff of baking spice, while the palate offers straightforward plum and clove flavors. It's easy-drinking and has mellow tannins.
title: Cantine Bellini 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)

description: Melon and a green note of pole beans and lettuce set up a high-acid citric palate. Grassy notes of clover and lettuce infiltrate core citrus flavors, while this shows lemony punch and an herbal note on a juicy tangy finish.
title: Castro Martin 2015 A2O Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: This is a pleasant bottle, with delicate fruit flavors that suggest watermelon and strawberry—nothing riper. There's a distinct impression of white balsamic vinegar, adding a high-toned lift that's just on the edge of too much, at least for some tasters.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Dampier Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: There is plenty of Merlot in this ripe wine which is produced in the Listrac cooperative. Spice and attractive tannins give the wine structure and perfume. They contrast with the juicy blackberry fruits and fine crisp acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Capdet 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: This is a soft ripe wine. It has already delicious red fruits and gentle tannins. With a generous rich palate, it is full bodied and packed with jammy Merlot flavors. The wine will be ready to drink soon, certainly by late 2017.
title: Château de Tourteyron 2014  Médoc

description: The wine is fruity and also textured. The acidity and dry tannin and wood flavors reveal a wine that will need to develop. It has weight and potential richness that will come out over the next couple of years. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2014 Cuvée Laurence H.  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The dryness and tannins of this wine are on the outside. Inside it has plenty of juicy fruit, sweet acidity and black plum flavors. Put the two together and this ripe wine offers plenty of potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Luchey-Halde 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Fresh and juicy, this full-bodied while structured wine comes from the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, which gives the fruitiness and blackberry fruit flavors. It will develop quickly and can be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Peyfaures 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Coming from the warm 2013 vintage, this easy-drinking wine offers notes of sweet corn, pear and peach with light barrel accents. The fruit flavors are elegant with a lightly creamy feel.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is an aromatic wine with notes of rose water, pear and white flowers. It drinks medium sweet with abundant spice flavors throughout. Pair with spicy Thai dishes.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This concentrated, structured wine has an earthy quality, typical of some Listracs, along with a more juicy, fruity character that's boosted by acidity. Balanced, it will age over the medium-term. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Vieux Moulin 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: Menthol, scorched soil, toasted oak and plum aromas lead the nose on this blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah. On the palate, licorice, dried sage and espresso add interest to the black cherry flavors while firm, slightly astringent tannins provide support.
title: Cipriana 2012 Scopaio  (Bolgheri)

description: Aromas of bath oil and exotic fruits like lychee and mango come in front of a short, simple palate that's fresh. Lychee and mango flavors finish in tropical style, with a mild soapy note. The wine is varietally correct and well done.
title: Cuatro Vacas Gordas 2014 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Milk chocolate and pomegranate curiously mix in this mid-weight, lowly oaked nonvintage Cabernet, blended with 18% Merlot and 2% Petite Sirah. New American oak aged most of it, with a bit of French, too, only 25% of the whole new.
title: CULT NV Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Extremely fruity and rich, this stops just short of sweetness while delivering delicious cherry, mixed berry and plum flavors with just a touch of tannin and acidity to keep it fresh. It is quite full bodied and ready to drink now.
title: Entropy Cellars NV Syzygy Red (Livermore Valley)

description: Tech sheets hint at Stagecoach Vineyard being involved somehow in this Syrah, a chewy expression of coconut, smoke and game around a dense, concentrated body and well-integrated tannins. The finish is all about mocha.
title: Cameron Hughes 2011 Lot 423 Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of toast, espresso and mature plum lead to a tightly wound palate that offers roasted coffee bean, licorice and walnut alongside tough, astringent tannins.
title: Capanne Ricci 2009 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and a tough core. The juicy fruit is taking its time develop, although it will provide density and ripe berry fruits in time. The vineyard, created in the early 1980s, is now at peak maturity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: Powerful and structured, this has dense tannins that will always be an important part of the wine. The juicy, fresh fruit gives a perfumed character to the wine and brings out acidity as well as the dry texture. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Lalaudey 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Ripe and perfumed, this is packed with the richness of 2010 along with its structure. It has weight, juicy black and red berry fruits and a tense structure that still needs time. Acidity at the end provides a fresh lift to the essentially firm wine.
title: Château Maine d'Arman 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: Coming from the cool 2011 vintage this wine offers a blue-fruit profile seldom seen in the state for this variety along with notes of chocolate and coffee. It's elegantly styled with a soft feel, trailing toward the finish.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine offers aromatic notes of blueberry and barrel spices. It's smooth and easy-drinking, not offering much complexity but bringing plenty of appeal.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Earthy aromas include new leather, scorched soil, wild berry and a touch of funky game. On the robust palate, grilled sage, tobacco and licorice add depth to a core of fleshy wild cherry along a backbone of raspy tannins and searing alcohol. Drink after 2018.
title: Citille di Sopra 2010 Vigna Poggio Ronconi  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This is a deep-colored, ripe wine, with touches of wood well embedded in the spicy, rich blackberry fruits. The wine is juicy, with dry, dusty tannins promising some aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Clos Monicord 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This conveys aromas of mature dark fruit and leafy underbrush. The firm palate displays stewed plum, ground pepper and a hint of dried sage alongside extremely astringent tannins that cut short the finish. Tried twice with the same notes.
title: Donatella Cinelli Colombini 2010  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Coffee grinds, raisin and baked aromas suggest overripeness. This is heavy, broad and a bit clumsy on the palate. Berry and prune flavors are solid but not overly fresh, while the finish is full and raisiny as it improves over time.
title: Jaspi 2011 Negre Red (Montsant)

description: This is still closed and extremely tannic but opens with aromas of underbrush, mature berry, tilled soil and game. The palate offers dried cherry, grilled sage and a leathery note alongside dry, raspy tannins.
title: Poggio Nardone 2010  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This is well-balanced and ripe, with plenty of room for both the attractive black fruits and the firm tannic structure. Wood aging shows, although it will integrate well. The wine is fruity, likely to be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Château Courbian  (Médoc)

description: This offers appealing notes of cranberry, cherry and orange peel along with a kiss of vanilla. It's tart and fresh in style with puckering fruit flavors—perfect for the dinner table.
title: Shooting Star 2012 Blue Franc Blaufränkisch (Washington)

description: Hailing from 1970s plantings, this wine is directly appealing with aromas of corn silk, candy corn, caramel and spice. The palate is sleek in style with plump peach flavors. Try it with crab.
title: Shooting Star 2013 Aligoté (Yakima Valley)

description: Sanguine in cassis, cranberry and wild strawberry, this relatively inexpensive Napa Cab has an herbal edge that suggests elegance and balance. The finish is stamped in oak that lingers on the palate without overwhelming.
title: Stickybeak 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A mix of smoke and toast blends with fresh, crisp citrus aromas on the nose. That's followed by a foamy, reactive palate with flavors of pink grapefruit, orange, pepper and caramel. This remains foamy on the finish, which is peppery and slightly bitter in flavor.
title: Sumarroca NV Yá Cuvée 23 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: Crisp lemon, fennel and Bosc pear come into play in this medium-bodied Chardonnay, accented by a taste of fig. Taking on depth and breadth as it develops in the glass and on the palate, the wine finishes long and lean.
title: Taft Street 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Underbrush, tobacco and spiced plum aromas lead the nose. On the straightforward palate, notes of anise and clove add depth to the black cherry core. It's easy drinking, with lithe tannins.
title: Terre del Marchesato 2012 Emilio Primo  (Bolgheri)

description: Aromas of cooked fruit, stewed plum, toast, coffee and vanilla lead the nose. The warm palate offers up fleshy black cherry, mocha and a licorice note, with the warmth of alcohol on the midpalate. It's already accessible so drink soon.
title: Terre Nere 2009 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This lovely sparkling wine is made with no dosage or added sugar. It offers scents of warm, just baked bread, citrus and roasted almond. The palate offers peach, apple, citrus and a hint of walnut along with crisp, clean acidity. It's smooth, with fine bubbles and a creamy texture.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2009 Pas Dosé Vintage Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Sourced from parcels of vines planted in the 1950s, 1960s and 1970s, this a fine, concentrated wine. It has rich structure, great maturity and complexity. Lime acidity mingles with rich white-fruit flavors, balancingdelicacy with intensity. Drink from 2016.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Fourchaume Premier Cru Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: A blend of two parcels of vines in Meursault, this is an impressive wine that's equal in quality to a Premier Cru. Full and ripe, the palate boasts flavors of apples, peaches and green plums, but maintains an elegant character throughout. Age this fine wine and drink from 2016.
title: Patrick Javillier 2011 Cuvée Tête de Murger  (Meursault)

description: A limited edition of selected wines from São Miguel, this is a powerful statement of the rich and dense Alentejano wines. It is complex as well, its solid tannins supporting huge black-fruit flavors, balanced acidity and a final juicy, very ripe finish. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Private Collection Red (Alentejano)

description: A full five years old but still with a long life ahead of it, this wine is in full blossom with notes of petrol, slate and white flowers. Harvested at 38.3 Brix and retaining 222 g/L of residual sugar, it's full of concentrated, rich apricot flavors that linger after each sip for close to a minute.
